deliver.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to take goods, letters, packages etc to a particular place or person
deliver.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: The morning mail has just been delivered.
I’m having some flowers delivered for her birthday.
They set off to deliver supplies to an isolated village.
deliver.translation[0].definitions[1].de: to do or provide the things you are expected to, because you are responsible for them or they are part of your job
deliver.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: the costs of delivering adequate nursing care
the failure of some services to deliver the goods (=do what they have promised)
The company will deliver on its promises.
deliver.translation[0].definitions[2].de: to help a woman give birth to her baby, or to give birth to a baby
deliver.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: They rushed her to hospital where doctors delivered her baby.
deliver.translation[0].definitions[3].de: to give something such as a blow, shock, or warning to someone or something
deliver.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: He delivered a strong warning about the dangers facing the government.
deliver.translation[0].definitions[4].de: to put someone into someone else’s control
deliver.translation[0].definitions[4].ex: Sharett had betrayed him and delivered him to the enemy.
deliver.translation[0].definitions[5].de: to get the votes or support of a particular group of people in an election
deliver.translation[0].definitions[5].ex: He cannot deliver the Latino vote.
deliver.translation[0].definitions[6].de: to help someone escape from something bad or evil
deliver.translation[1].definitions[0].de: to take goods or mail to a place
deliver.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: An average of 52 tankers a day deliver 462 million gallons of crude oil, gasoline and other petroleum products to the U.S.
The new computers will be delivered next week.
deliver.translation[1].definitions[1].de: to provide or achieve something that other people benefit from
deliver.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: Since January 2005, the fund has delivered an annual return of 14.7%.
Good government can deliver a high level of services while maintaining fiscal discipline.
The question is whether the company can deliver on these commitments.
